content.rendered:
The mile high city is a great place to spend an afternoon, a day, a week or a month. There is no shortage of activities and events to entertain folks of all ages:

Mount Evans: Located 30 miles to the west of Denver is the famed Mount Evans. Ranked number 1 on tripadvisor.com for attractions in Denver, Mount Evans stands at 14,265 feet above sea level. In the summer months, visitors and locals alike flock to the illustrious peak to take in the splendid sights. Take the 14 mile drive from Idaho Springs up the mountain road to see some fantastic views of the city of Denver as well as the majestic Rocky Mountains. Bighorn Sheep, scenic lakes, and ancient trees are just a few of the things you can experience while journeying up to the summit of Mount Evans.

Coors Field: Home of Major League Baseball’s Colorado Rockies, Coors Field is a fun way to spend an afternoon or an evening taking in a ballgame. Located in the heart of downtown Denver within walking distance to many bars, shops, and restaurants, Coors Field is in the perfect location for a day trip to the heart of Denver.

Elitch Gardens Theme Park: America’s only downtown theme and water park, Elitch Gardens is open from May – October. There are activities and attractions available for children of all ages, Elitch Gardens is the perfect place to spend a day with the family. Check out the 20 story high observation tower to see some breathtaking views of the city. There are more than 50 rides within the theme park to make sure there is never a shortage of thrills for you and your family.

Coors Brewery: Nestled at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in a mining town known as Golden, sits the historic Coors Brewery. The former capital of Colorado, Golden is chalk full of history and attractions. The largest of these attractions is the Coors Brewery. Stop by and take a free tour of the facility, along with complimentary samples of the different products produced by Coors Brewing. Make sure you have your ID if you are 21 so you can participate in the sampling!
